meanings.definition: A person who drives a herd of cattle or sheep.
meanings.sent1: The drover guided the cattle across the field.
meanings.sent2: The drover led the sheep to the pasture.
meanings.sent3: The drover and his dog made quite the team herding the animals.
meanings.sent4: Like a skilled conductor, the drover orchestrated the movement of the herd.
meanings.sent5: The drover's job is to ensure the animals reach their destination safely.

meanings.sent1: She will drover the cattle to the grazing area.
meanings.sent2: He drover the sheep back to the barn.
meanings.sent3: The children pretended to drover their toy animals around the room.
meanings.sent4: The sound of the whistle helped the drover gather the scattered herd.
meanings.sent5: In the early morning, the drover set out to begin herding the animals.
